snippet: François Englert of Belgium and Peter W. Higgs of Britain were honored for suggesting that an invisible ocean of energy is responsible for the mass and diversity of the universe.
abstract: Francois Englert of Belgium and Peter W Higgs of Britain, theoretical physicists who suggested an invisible ocean of energy is responsible for the mass and diversity of the universe, win Nobel Prize in Physics; their 1964 theory sent physicists on a generation-long search for a particle that confers mass on other particles, also known as Higgs boson, culminating in its discovery in 2012.
lead_paragraph: François Englert of Belgium and Peter W. Higgs of Britain were honored for suggesting that an invisible ocean of energy is responsible for the mass and diversity of the universe.

headline.seo: Higgs and Englert Are Awarded Nobel Prize in Physics
headline.main: For Nobel, They Can Thank the ‘God Particle’
headline.print_headline: For Nobel, They Can Thank the ‘God Particle’
